title: What to Watch This Week: 40 Premieres, Finales and More
description: To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025. author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: The Bondsman, Dying for Sex, MobLand, Pulse and more! Find out what's new, returning and leaving the small screen over the next seven days.
text: To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025. This week, you’ll find a dozen new shows (including Kevin Bacon in The Bondsman, Michelle Williams in Dying for Sex and Willa Fitzgerald in Pulse), 10 returning favorites (including Call the Midwife, The Simpsons and SurrealEstate) and five finales (including the last episode of Fox bubble drama Rescue: HI-Surf). Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email us and your question may be answered in Matt’s Inside Line. html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, you’ll find a dozen new shows (including Kevin Bacon in The Bondsman, Michelle Williams in Dying for Sex and Willa Fitzgerald in Pulse), 10 returning favorites (including Call the Midwife, The Simpsons and SurrealEstate) and five finales (including the last episode of Fox bubble drama Rescue: HI-Surf).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email us and your question may be answered in Matt’s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, MARCH 30

📺 MobLand (Paramount+)
Pierce Brosnan and Helen Mirren lead this crime drama about two warring families — and the fiercely loyal fixer (Tom Hardy) who is charged with protecting one of them at all costs.

📺 8 pm Call the Midwife Season 14 (PBS)
📺 8 pm County Rescue Season 2 finale (Great American Family)
📺 8 pm The Simpsons spring premiere (Fox, next day on Hulu)
📺 8:30 pm Family Guy time period premiere (Fox, next day on Hulu)
📺 11:30 pm Common Side Effects Season 1 finale (Adult Swim)

MONDAY, MARCH 31

📺 Gone Girls: The Long Island Serial Killer (Netflix, three-episode binge)
The docuseries examines the hunt for the Long Island serial killer through the perspective of his victims, their loved ones and the police.

📺 8 pm In Dispute: Lively v. Baldoni (Investigation Discovery special)
📺 9 pm Rescue: HI-Surf Season 1 finale (Fox, next day on Hulu)
📺 10 pm An Oprah Winfrey Special: The Menopause Revolution (ABC, next day on Hulu)

TUESDAY, APRIL 1

📺 America’s Test Kitchen: The Next Generation Season 2 (Prime Video, 10-episode binge)
📺 8 pm The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills Season 14 reunion (Bravo, three-week event)
📺 8 pm Street Outlaws Season 2 (Discovery Channel)

🎥 9 pm Liza: A Truly Terrific Absolutely True Story (PBS documentary)
This installment of American Masters offers an intimate look into the life of Liza Minnelli, the iconic actress best known for her Oscar-winning performance in Cabaret. 

🎥 Before Dawn (Paramount+ With Showtime)
🎥 The Last Stop in Yuma County (Paramount+ With Showtime)

📺 10 pm The Death Coast (History Channel)
Shipwreck hunter Jeff Mackinnon explores the extremely dangerous “Death Coast.”

🤣 Nimesh Patel: Instant Karma (Netflix comedy special)

WEDNESDAY, APRIL 2

📺 Love on the Spectrum Season 3 (Netflix, seven-episode binge)

📺 8 pm Oklahoma City Bombing: One Day in America (NatGeo)
The docuseries offers a moment-by-moment account of the 1995 bombing, including extraordinary stories of survival, heroic rescue efforts and the nationwide search that followed.

📺 9 pm Fix My Frankenhouse Season 2 (HGTV)
📺 9 pm Pawn Stars Season 23 finale (History Channel)

THURSDAY, APRIL 3

📺 The Bondsman (Prime Video, eight-episode binge)
Kevin Bacon plays a murdered bounty hunter who is resurrected by the Devil to trap and send back demons that have escaped from Hell.

📺 Devil May Cry (Netflix, eight-episode binge)
In this anime, when a mysterious villain threatens to open the gates of Hell, a devilishly handsome demon hunter could be the world’s best hope for salvation.

📺 Pulse (Netflix, 10-episode binge)
Willa Fitzgerald, Colin Woodell and Justina Machado star in this medical procedural set at Miami’s busiest Level 1 trauma center.

📺 House of David Season 1 finale (Prime Video)
📺 Jurassic World: Chaos Theory Season 3 (Netflix, 10-episode binge)
📺 9 pm Flipping 101 w/ Tarek El Moussa Season 4 (HGTV)
📺 10 pm Hacks Season 1 basic cable premiere (TBS, five-night event)
📺 10 pm SurrealEstate Season 3 (Syfy)

FRIDAY, APRIL 4

📺 Dying for Sex (Hulu, eight-episode binge)
The Michelle Williams miniseries is inspired by the Story of one woman’s terminal cancer diagnosis and the unconventional journey that beckons.

📺 Martin Scorsese Presents: The Saints Season 1B (Fox Nation)
📺 8 pm Grosse Pointe Garden Society time slot premiere (NBC, next day on Peacock)

📺 10 pm Secrets Declassified With David Duchovny (History)
Duchovny presents the latest evidence behind some of the government’s most secretive, strange and mind-blowing activities.

🎥 Girl You Know It’s True (Peacock)
🎥 Y2K (Max)

SATURDAY, APRIL 5

📺 9:30 am Iyanu (Cartoon Network)
Drawing on Nigerian culture, music, and mythology, the animated series follows a brave young orphan living in the magical kingdom of Yorubaland. 

📺 12 pm Beer Budget Reno (A&E)
Kristen Coutts specializes in life-changing home renovations for those told they can’t afford them.

📺 8 pm Say Yes to the Dress Season 23 (TLC)

📺 12 am Lazarus (Adult Swim)
The anime follows secret agents hunting for a vaccine to save humanity.

What are you watching this week? Take stock of everything above, then drop a comment with your lists below.

Best Streaming Deals This Month
